    • Constructor Detail

      • HostModel

        public HostModel(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.Boolean isLocal,
                 int numPlayers)
        The HostModel function is the constructor of the HostModel class. The HostModel function will create a new thread that will run the game management function. and then will wait for all players to connect before starting a new game. Once all players have connected, it will send out tiles to each player until they have 7 tiles in their hand (the maximum number of tiles allowed). Then, once every player has 7 tiles in their hand, it will start taking turns from each player until one wins or there are no more moves left on the board
        Parameters:
        name - Set the name of the host player
        isLocal - Determine whether the game is local or remote
        numPlayers - Determine how many players are playing the game

      • giveTiles

      • TryPutWordInBoard

        public void TryPutWordInBoard(java.lang.String requestType,
                              java.lang.String word,
                              java.lang.String row,
                              java.lang.String col,
                              java.lang.String vertical)
        The TryPutWordInBoard function is responsible for trying to place a word on the board. It first creates a Word object from the given parameters, and then tries to place it on the board. If the word was a part of a successful challenge request, we add a bonus of 10 points, and update all relevant data structures: The player's score is updated by calling addScore(score), his tiles are removed by calling removeStrTiles(word) and he gets new tiles in return by calling giveTiles(). We also update our matrix representation of the board with updateMatrixBoard(), set an appropriate message for the view. If the request failed the word tiles are returned to the current player.
        Parameters:
        requestType - Determine if the word was requested using a challenge or a query
        word - Create a word object
        row - Determine the row where the first letter of the word will be placed
        col - Determine the column of the first letter of a word
        vertical - Determine if the word is placed vertically or horizontally

      • setUserQueryInput

        public void setUserQueryInput(java.lang.String word,
                              java.lang.String row,
                              java.lang.String col,
                              java.lang.String vertical)
        The setUserQueryInput function is called after the user has entered a word and its details in the GUI when its is turn. The function checks if the word is valid, and if so, it adds it to the board and updated the players relevant information. If not, it offers to challenge.
        Specified by:
        setUserQueryInput in interface GameModel
        Parameters:
        word - Set the word that the player entered
        row - Stores the row number of the first letter of a word
        col - Stores the column number of the first letter of a word
        vertical - Determine whether the word is placed vertically or horizontally on the board

      • setUserChallengeInput

        public void setUserChallengeInput(java.lang.String request)
        The setUserChallengeInput function is used to set the user challenge input. It calls other functions to check the challenge, if successful it tries to put the word in the board using TryPutWordInBoard The function sets relevant messages for each result.
        Specified by:
        setUserChallengeInput in interface GameModel
        Parameters:
        request - Determine whether the user wants to challenge or not

      • playerTurn

        public void playerTurn(Player player)
        The playerTurn function is responsible for giving the player tiles at its first turn, notifying observers of the name, score and tiles of a player hoe is currently starting its turn. It also sets a message to be displayed on screen.
        Parameters:
        player - Pass the player how's turn to play to the function

      • testDictionary

        public boolean testDictionary(java.lang.String requestType,
                              java.lang.String word,
                              java.lang.String row,
                              java.lang.String col,
                              java.lang.String vertical,
                              java.net.Socket gameSocket)
        The testDictionary function takes in a requestType, word, row, col and vertical. It then creates the appropriate string to send to the game server based on whether it is a query or challenge. The function then writes this string to the socket and reads from it as well. If true is returned by the server we return true otherwise false is returned by our function.
        Parameters:
        requestType - Determine whether the client is sending a query or a challenge request to the server
        word - the requested word
        row - Determine the row of the first letter in a word
        col - Determine the column of the first letter in a word
        vertical - Determine if the word is being placed vertically or horizontally
        gameSocket - Pass the socket to communicate with the game server to the function
        Returns:
        A boolean value that indicates whether the word is in the dictionary

      • stopLocalGame

        public void stopLocalGame()
        The stopLocalGame function is called when a local game ends. It sets the winner to be whoever has the highest score, and then closes all of the sockets that were opened during gameplay.
